snippet: State broadcasters and newspapers have quickly allied with the Egypt’s generals over President Mohamed Morsi, making it clear who still holds the real power over Egypt’s bureaucracy.
abstract: Egypt's state-run media have quickly allied with the generals who took power at the ouster of Hosni Mubarak over current Pres Mohamed Morsi, making it clear who still holds the real power over Egypt’s bureaucracy.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: State broadcasters and newspapers have quickly allied with the Egypt’s generals over President Mohamed Morsi, making it clear who still holds the real power over Egypt’s bureaucracy.

headline.seo: President Morsi of Egypt Is Undercut by State-Run Media
headline.main: Egypt’s New President Is Being Undercut by State-Run Media
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s New President Is Being Undercut By State-Run Media
